name: unity-mcp
description: Multi-agent MCP server for Unity Editor — 259 tools (66 core + 193 advanced via two-tier system) across 24 categories with multi-instance support. Designed for Claude Cowork with async queue and fair scheduling across agents.
long_description:
AnkleBreaker Unity MCP connects Claude to your Unity Editor with 259 tools across 24 categories. Built for Claude Cowork's multi-agent architecture, where multiple AI agents collaborate on the same Unity project in parallel.

**Key features:**
- 259 tools via two-tier system: 66 core tools always available + 193 advanced tools on-demand via unity_advanced_tool
- Two-tier architecture keeps MCP payload under 32KB for reliable client registration
- Multi-instance support: run multiple Unity Editors simultaneously, auto-port selection (7890–7899), shared instance registry
- ParrelSync clone detection for multiplayer development workflows
- Multi-agent async queue with fair round-robin scheduling
- Read batching (up to 5/frame) and write serialization (1/frame)
- Agent session tracking and action logging
- Project Context auto-injection for project-aware AI assistance
- Automatic fallback to legacy sync mode for older plugin versions

**Requires the companion Unity Editor plugin:** Install via Unity Package Manager → Add package from git URL → `https://github.com/AnkleBreaker-Studio/unity-mcp-plugin.git`

After installing the plugin, open Window → AB Unity MCP in Unity and verify the bridge is running.

unity_hub_path.title: Unity Hub Path
unity_hub_path.description: Path to Unity Hub executable. On Windows: C:\Program Files\Unity Hub\Unity Hub.exe — On macOS: /Applications/Unity Hub.app/Contents/MacOS/Unity Hub

bridge_port.title: Bridge Port
bridge_port.description: Default port for the Unity Editor plugin. With multi-instance support (v2.15.0+), ports are auto-discovered from the instance registry. Only used as fallback. Default: 7890

prompts.name: setup_scene
prompts.description: Set up a basic Unity scene with common elements
prompts.text: Help me set up a Unity scene. Start by checking the connection to Unity, then show me the current hierarchy. Ask what kind of scene I want to create (e.g., 3D platformer, FPS, puzzle game) and set up appropriate GameObjects, lighting, and a camera.

prompts.name: profile_and_optimize
prompts.description: Profile the project and suggest optimizations
prompts.text: Profile my Unity project and help me optimize it. Start the profiler, take a memory snapshot, check the console for warnings, and analyze the results. Give me specific, actionable recommendations for improving performance.
